ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Questions??????
ygData.msgSnippet: Dont use begging at all to be honest. There is no need to buy a compass these days since you get the one on the screen now. And your sense heading should be
ygData.messageBody:
Dont use begging at all to be honest.
There is no need to buy a compass these days since you
get the one on the screen now.
And your sense heading should be 200 or so when you
start so you always know the direction you will be in.
It does work it just does not stay pegged , it strafes
a bit.

To improve safe fall you need to find a spot you can
fall off of and eventually you will see the skill go
up. Keep trying, be patient.

If you want a black racial character you need to play
an erudite. You just can't be an Erudite Monk...
heheh

Hope this helps

Rob


--- Robert <Rengar65@...> wrote:
> Ok, I'm new to this group and to playing EQ.
>
> My questions may be redundant to those asked by
> others here or even
> off the wall but her goes.
>
> Does any one use begging?
>
> I have built mine to 23 (not real hi I know but the
> character is only
> 9th level) so far all it has done is get me 2 copper
> and attacked
> twice. Not good odds (one attack per copper).
>
> Why do I have direction sense? And why would you
> buy a compass?
>
> I have a compass on my screen. I already know what
> direction I am
> facing. My direction sense is at 200 and it still
> only works about
> 60% of the time.
>
> As a monk, how do I improve my safe fall skill
> without spending all
> my points on it?
>
> I keep jumping off tall things and taking damage but
> no improvement.
>
>
> Why are all the characters white? What if I want to
> play a black
> person?
>
> Well that's about it for now. I look foreword
> (because my eyes are
> in the front of my head :P ) to your answers.
>
> Robert
>
>
>
